Package remodel.expr

Class InvocationExpression

java.lang.Object
remodel.expr.Expression
remodel.expr.MultipleExpression
remodel.expr.InvocationExpression
All Implemented Interfaces:
PriorityCodes
public class InvocationExpression
extends MultipleExpression
InvocationExpression is a kind of MultipleExpression denoting the invocation of a message on a receiver. The receiver is any Expression that evaluates to an object, and the message names one of the object's Properties - whether an Operation, Attribute, Reference or Component. An InvocationExpression optionally has one or more argument Expressions, if the message refers to an Operation with formal arguments.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • InvocationExpression

      public InvocationExpression​(Expression receiver, java.lang.String message)
      Creates an InvocationExpression with the given receiver and message. The receiver evaluates to an object, and the message names one of this object's properties - whether an Attribute or Operation.
      Parameters:
      receiver - the receiver Expression.
      message - the message name.

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public java.lang.String getType()
      Looks up the type of this InvocationExpression. Returns the type of the Property whose name matches the message, where the Property is found by searching the Concept matching the type of the receiver.
      Specified by:
      getType in class Expression
      Returns:
      the type of this Expression.

      public Property getDefinition()

    • getNesting

      public int getNesting()
      Returns an estimate of this InvocationExpression's nesting. Returns one more than the receiver' level of nesting.
      Overrides:
      getNesting in class Expression
      Returns:
      zero by default; overridden in subclasses.

    • writeUsing

      public void writeUsing​(ExpressionVisitor visitor) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from class: Expression
      Receives an ExpressionVisitor to write out this kind of Expression. This follows the Visitor Design Pattern idiom.
      Specified by:
      writeUsing in class Expression
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ExpressionVisitor.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.
